edu.caltech.sbw
Class ConfigVars

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.caltech.sbw.ConfigVars
public final class ConfigVars
extends Object

This class manages certain flags that have to be physically changed at compile time. An example is the TRACING flag below. This flag needs to be set at compile time so that the Java compiler can make optimizations such as removing code that depends on a static final constant having a value of false.

Having to edit code to change a flag is obviously not an elegant solution. It is unfortunately necessary because Java lacks a (standard) preprocessor and the standard Java compilers do not provide a compile-time variable assignment feature like -DTRACING=true. (Yes, the JRE does provide the latter, so one possibility would be to use this to reset flag values at run time. Unfortunately, it is uncertain whether a JIT compiler will properly elide code that depends on a static final constant redefined using -DTRACING=false.)

Under Unix/Linux, it's possible to edit this file programmatically (using, e.g., sed) and thereby automate the setting of some flags. This is the approach followed here. See the Makefile in ../../../Makefile.

Version:
$Version$
Author:
Michael Hucka, $Author: mhucka $

Field Detail

TRACING

public static final boolean TRACING
Two levels of debugging are used in SBW: tracing and logging. Tracing provides detailed debugging information about runtime activities, but is unnecessary in the deployed application. It's therefore controlled by a static final boolean flag that can only be changed at compile time. The flag is used in a conditional below in the trace method. This takes advantage of the fact that the Java compiler will optimize away empty inlined code, and therefore calls to SBWLog.trace will be removed entirely when TRACE = false. (See the discussion on p. 143 in "Learning Java" by Niemeyer and Knudsen, O'Reilly, 2000.) In production code, the tracing flag is false. Change the value to true and recompile SBW to enable tracing.

This flag is reset from the Makefile (under Unix/Linux) using a sed command when SBWCore is being compiled in debugging mode.

SBW_VERSION

public static final String SBW_VERSION
The SBW version string, accessible using the method Config.getSBWVersion(). The version string needs to be updated manually. (IMPORTANT: This cannot be tied to CVS's $Version$ keyword because individual files like ConfigVars.java may be changed without changing all files. Consequently, the numbering of release versions must be left to a human.)

SBW_BUILD

public static final int SBW_BUILD
The SBW build version, accessible using the method Config.getSBWVersion(). This integer is auto-updated from the build/make environment. See ../../../Makefile.
